    In 298 days, President Trump has made 1,628 false and misleading claims

    The Fact Checker’s ongoing database of the false and misleading claims made by President Trump during his first 365 days in office.

      Repeated 33 times:Mar 10Mar 13Mar 14Mar 15Mar 18Mar 20Jun 7Jun 11Jun 13Jun 21Jul 6Aug 3Aug 4Aug 10Aug 12Sep 6Sep 8Sep 19Sep 22Oct 6Oct 7Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 17Oct 21Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Most recent

    Nov 9 2017

    “I don’t blame China, I blame the incompetence of past Admins for allowing China to take advantage of the U.S. on trade leading up to a point where the U.S. is losing $100's of billions. How can you blame China for taking advantage of people that had no clue? I would've done same!”

    Topic: Economy

    Source: Twitter

    Trump blasts previous administrations for letting trade deficits with China to climb. But the United States is not losing "100s of billions of dollars" on trade deficits. That reflects a fundamental misunderstanding. A trade deficit simply means that people in one country are buying more goods from another country than people in the second country are buying from the first country. Americans want to buy these products from overseas, either because of quality or price. If Trump sparked a trade war and tariffs were increased on Chinese goods, then it would raise the cost of those products to Americans. Perhaps that would reduce the purchases of those goods, and thus reduce the trade deficit, but that would not mean the United States would “gain” money that had been lost.

    Nov 8 2017

    “Congratulations to all of the 'DEPLORABLES' and the millions of people who gave us a MASSIVE (304-227) Electoral College landslide victory!”

    Repeated 7 times:
    Apr 16May 10Jun 9Jul 24Sep 22Oct 25Nov 8

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    According to a tally by John Pitney of Claremont McKenna College, every Republican president since Rutherford B. Hayes in 1876 won a larger share of the electoral college votes than Trump, with the exception of George W. Bush (twice) and Nixon in 1968.

    Nov 7 2017

    “@EdWGillespie will totally turn around the high crime and poor economic performance of VA. MS-13 and crime will be gone. Vote today, ASAP!”

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    Virginia has among the lowest crime and unemployment rates in the United States.

    Nov 7 2017

    “Ed Gillespie worked hard but did not embrace me or what I stand for. Don’t forget, Republicans won 4 out of 4 House seats, and with the economy doing record numbers, we will continue to win, even bigger than before!”

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    Trump, who tweeted repeatedly in favor of Gillespie, ignores a House race in which the Republican lost.

    Nov 7 2017

    “Stock market hit yet another all-time record high yesterday.”

    Repeated 57 times
    Feb 16Feb 16Feb 18Feb 28Mar 2Jul 2Jul 6Jul 12Jul 12Jul 15Jul 19Jul 24Jul 24Jul 25Jul 29Jul 31Jul 31Aug 1Aug 2Aug 3Aug 3Aug 4Aug 11Aug 14Aug 15Aug 22Sep 1Sep 6Sep 19Sep 22Sep 26Sep 27Sep 29Oct 5Oct 6Oct 6Oct 7Oct 10Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 24Oct 31Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Topic: Economy

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    This is a flip-flop for Trump. Before he was elected, he dismissed the stock-market performance under Obama as “artificial” and “a bubble."

    Nov 7 2017

    “The U.S., under my administration, is completely rebuilding its military, and they're spending hundreds of billions of dollars to the newest and finest military equipment anywhere in the world, being built right now. I want peace through strength!”

    Repeated 14 times
    Feb 28Mar 2Mar 15May 17May 21May 27Jun 21Jul 12Jul 25Aug 22Oct 17Nov 5Nov 7Nov 7

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    This is false. Trump's proposed ten percent increase is actually relatively modest. In the past 30 years, at least one-third of the time the core defense budget was boosted more than Trump's request--in some cases more than double the percentage requested by Trump.

    Nov 6 2017

    “I have great confidence in King Salman and the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia, they know exactly what they are doing. Some of those they are harshly treating have been “milking” their country for years!”

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    Trump praises an extrajudicial action in Saudi Arabia, which ordinarily the State Department would say was troubling. The arrests and detentions were down under the guise of thwarting corruption, but that's just a fig leaf that Trump appears to endorse.

    Nov 6 2017

    “My visit to Japan and friendship with PM Abe will yield many benefits, for our great Country. Massive military & energy orders happening+++!”

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    The Japanese government immediately disputed this statement. The Japan Times quoted a defense official as saying: “We’ll proceed with the existing plan, without worrying about the president’s remarks.”

    Nov 6 2017

    “The state of Virginia economy, under Democrat rule, has been terrible.”

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    Virginia has among the lowest unemployment rates in the United States -- lower than the rest of the country.

    Nov 4 2017

    “Would very much appreciate Saudi Arabia doing their IPO of Aramco with the New York Stock Exchange. Important to the United States!”

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    The reason for the Saudi reluctance is because of passage of the Justice Against Sponsors of Terrorism Act, which could result in the seizure of Saudi assets. During the campaign, Trump strongly supported JASTA and blasted Obama for vetoing it. (Congress overturned Obama's veto.)

    Nov 4 2017

    “Unemployment is down to 4.1%, lowest in 17 years. 1.5 million new jobs created since I took office. Highest stock Market ever, up $5.4 trill”

    Repeated 33 times
    Mar 10Mar 13Mar 14Mar 15Mar 18Mar 20Jun 7Jun 11Jun 13Jun 21Jul 6Aug 3Aug 4Aug 10Aug 12Sep 6Sep 8Sep 19Sep 22Oct 6Oct 7Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 17Oct 21Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Topic: Jobs

    Source: Twitter

    Trump now uses data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics unemployment rate to say this, which is a flip-flop from his previous claims dismissing the BLS unemployment rate as "nonsense."

    Nov 3 2017

    “New Donna B book says she paid for and stole the Dem Primary. What about the deleted E-mails, Uranium, Podesta, the Server, plus, plus.”

    Repeated 10 times
    Feb 16Mar 27Mar 28Apr 30Jul 19Jul 22Jul 25Aug 3Oct 25Nov 3

    Topic: Russia

    Source: Twitter

    Trump suggests the State Department under Hillary Clinton had sole approval authority on a uranium rights deal with a company largely owned by Russia’s nuclear energy agency. But the State Department is one of nine agencies in the Committee on Foreign Investments in the United States to vet and sign off on all U.S. transactions involving foreign governments. There is no evidence Clinton herself got involved in the deal personally, and it is highly questionable that this deal even rose to the level of the secretary of state. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission also needed to approve, and did approve, the transfer.

    Nov 2 2017

    “Donna Brazile just stated the DNC RIGGED the system to illegally steal the Primary from Bernie Sanders. Bought and paid for by Crooked H. This is real collusion and dishonesty. Major violation of Campaign Finance Laws and Money Laundering.”

    Repeated 1 time
    Nov 2

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    Trump is referring to a financial arrangement the Clinton campaign had with the Democratic National Committee, which was similar to one the Trump campaign had with the Republican National Committee. It's no coincidence Trump would raise false charges of money laundering shortly after his former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, was indicted for money laundering.

    Nov 2 2017

    “This is real collusion and dishonesty. Major violation of Campaign Finance Laws and Money Laundering - where is our Justice Department?”

    Repeated 1 time
    Nov 2

    Topic: Election

    Source: Twitter

    Trump is referring to a financial arrangement the Clinton campaign had with the Democratic National Committee, which was similar to one the Trump campaign had with the Republican National Committee. It's no coincidence Trump would raise false charges of money laundering shortly after his former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, was indicted for money laundering.

    Nov 1 2017

    “The terrorist came into our country through what is called the "Diversity Visa Lottery Program," a Chuck Schumer beauty. I want merit based.”

    Topic: Immigration

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    Schumer did advocate for the diversity visa program in 1990, but Trump’s tweets entirely miss the context in which the program was created (mainly to help the Irish). Moreover, Schumer he helped craft a bill that would have eliminated it 23 years later.

    Fact Checker rating:

    Nov 1 2017

    “Push Biggest Tax Cuts EVER”

    Repeated 40 times
    May 1May 1May 4May 4May 5May 17May 18Jun 7Jun 8Jun 21Jun 26Jul 25Sep 6Sep 22Sep 24Sep 27Sep 29Oct 6Oct 6Oct 6Oct 7Oct 10Oct 11Oct 16Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 17Oct 18Oct 18Oct 25Oct 25Oct 29Oct 31Oct 31Nov 1Nov 1Nov 2Nov 2Nov 2

    Topic: Taxes

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    Trump’s tax cut would be nearly 0.9 percent of the gross domestic product, meaning it would be far smaller than President Ronald Reagan’s tax cut in 1981, which was 2.89 percent of GDP. Trump’s tax cut, if enacted in law, would be the eighth largest tax cut — and even smaller than two tax cuts passed under Barack Obama.

    Fact Checker rating:

    Oct 31 2017

    “The Fake News is working overtime. As Paul Manafort's lawyer said, there was 'no collusion' and events mentioned took place long before he came to the campaign. Few people knew the young, low level volunteer named George, who has already proven to be a liar.”

    Repeated 1 time
    Oct 30

    Topic: Russia

    Source: Twitter

    The indictment brought against Manafort, Trump's former campaign chairman, indicates illegal activity took place before, during and after Manafort's stint as Trump campaign chairman. George Papadopoulos was named by Trump as one of his national security advisers -- Trump called him "an excellent guy " -- and he attended a meeting with Trump and his national security advisers on March 31, 2016. Trump tweeted a photo of Papadopoulos attending the meeting.

    Oct 30 2017

    “Sorry, but this is years ago, before Paul Manafort was part of the Trump campaign.”

    Repeated 1 time
    Oct 31

    Topic: Russia

    Source: Twitter

    The indictment brought against Manafort, Trump's former campaign chairman, indicates illegal activity took place before, during and after Manafort's stint as Trump campaign chairman.

    Oct 30 2017

    “Report out that Obama Campaign paid $972,000 to Fusion GPS. The firm also got $12,400,000 (really?) from DNC!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Trump gets this completely mixed up. Perkins Coie, a law firm that worked for both the Democratic National Committee and the Clinton campaign, hired Fusion GPS. The Obama campaign also hired Perkins Coie. But that did not translate into all funding for the law firm equaling funds for Fusion GPS -- or that the Obama campaign had any connection to Fusion.

    Oct 29 2017

    “All of this 'Russia' talk right when the Republicans are making their big push for historic Tax Cuts & Reform.”

    Repeated 40 times
    May 1May 1May 4May 4May 5May 17May 18Jun 7Jun 8Jun 21Jun 26Jul 25Sep 6Sep 22Sep 24Sep 27Sep 29Oct 6Oct 6Oct 6Oct 7Oct 10Oct 11Oct 16Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 17Oct 18Oct 18Oct 25Oct 25Oct 29Oct 31Oct 31Nov 1Nov 1Nov 2Nov 2Nov 2

Trump’s tax cut, if enacted in law, would be the eighth largest tax cut — and even smaller than two tax cuts passed under Barack Obama.

    Fact Checker rating:

    Oct 28 2017

    “JFK Files are released, long ahead of schedule!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    A law signed by President George H.W. Bush in 1992 mandated that all records be released by Oct. 26, 2017. So the release was not ahead of schedule -- and many are still secret.

    Oct 28 2017

    “While not at all presidential I must point out that the Sloppy Michael Moore Show on Broadway was a TOTAL BOMB and was forced to close. Sad!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Actually, the show had a 12-week limited engagement and closed on time.

    Oct 27 2017

    “It is now commonly agreed, after many months of COSTLY looking, that there was NO collusion between Russia and Trump.”

    Source: Twitter

    Oct 25 2017

    Oct 21 2017

    “Keep hearing about 'tiny' amount of money spent on Facebook ads. What about the billions of dollars of Fake News on CNN, ABC, NBC & CBS?”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Trump received $5.6 billion of free media during the 2016 presidential campaign, more than Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, Ted Cruz, Paul Ryan and Marco Rubio combined, according to data from tracking firm mediaQuant.

    Oct 21 2017

    “Lowest unemployment in 17 yrs!”

    Repeated 33 times
    Mar 10Mar 13Mar 14Mar 15Mar 18Mar 20Jun 7Jun 11Jun 13Jun 21Jul 6Aug 3Aug 4Aug 10Aug 12Sep 6Sep 8Sep 19Sep 22Oct 6Oct 7Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 17Oct 21Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Oct 20 2017

    “Just out report: 'United Kingdom crime rises 13% annually amid spread of Radical Islamic terror.' Not good, we must keep America safe!”

    Topic: Terrorism

    Source: Twitter

    This tweet caused anger in the United Kingdom, as the statistic is fiction. The report cited by Trump barely mentioned terrorism.

    Oct 20 2017

    “The budget passed late last night, 51 to 49.”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Trump is referring to the nonbinding budget resolution which does not require a presidential signature. It's not really a budget.

    Oct 19 2017

    “The Fake News is going crazy with wacky Congresswoman Wilson(D), who was SECRETLY on a very personal call, and gave a total lie on content!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Wilson was an invited guest on the speakerphone condolence call between Trump and Myeshia Johnson, the widow of Sgt. La David Johnson, a soldier killed in Niger. Moreover, it turned out she did not lie, as her description of Trump's awkward phrasing was confirmed by White House chief of staff John Kelly.

    Oct 19 2017

    “Workers of firm involved with the discredited and Fake Dossier take the 5th.”

    Topic: Russia

    Source: Twitter

    While the dossier commissioned by Fusion GPS for Democrats contained salacious elements, broad portions have proven to be largely correct.

    Oct 18 2017

    “I am supportive of Lamar as a person & also of the process, but I can never support bailing out ins co's who have made a fortune w/ O'Care.”

    Repeated 10 times
    Oct 11Oct 13Oct 13Oct 16Oct 17Oct 17Oct 17Oct 17Oct 18Oct 18

    Topic: Health care

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    This claim is false. Insurance companies have actually lost billions in the Obamacare exchanges, according to company filings and industry analysts. For example, Aetna is on pace to lose $750 million from its participation in the exchanges — $100 million in 2014, $150 million in 2015, $300 million in 2016 and more than $200 million in 2017. As a result, it is not participating in 2018, a spokesman said. Humana announced it would leave the exchanges, saying it was too risky after losing $45 million in the individual market in 2017.

    Fact Checker rating:

    Oct 17 2017

    “Any increase in ObamaCare premiums is the fault of the Democrats for giving us a "product" that never had a chance of working.”

    Repeated 60 times
    Jan 25Feb 10Feb 16Feb 18Feb 27Mar 11Mar 13Mar 15Mar 17Mar 17Mar 17Mar 21Mar 25Apr 23Apr 24Apr 28Apr 29May 1May 4May 4May 5May 5May 5May 7May 12May 18May 28Jun 7Jun 7Jun 8Jun 13Jun 19Jun 19Jun 21Jun 22Jun 23Jun 23Jun 25Jun 27Jun 28Jul 12Jul 14Jul 18Jul 18Jul 18Jul 19Jul 22Jul 24Jul 25Jul 28Aug 22Sep 21Oct 7Oct 10Oct 16Oct 16Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 17

    Topic: Health care

    Source: Twitter

    This is misleading. Trump signed an executive order on Oct. 12 ending cost-sharing reduction payments to insurance companies. In August, the Congressional Budget Office estimated that without CSR payments, premiums for 2018 would increase by 20% over the CBO's current baseline and by 25% over the 2020 projection.

    Oct 14 2017

    “Very proud of my Executive Order which will allow greatly expanded access and far lower costs for HealthCare. Millions of people benefit!”

    Topic: Health care

    Source: Twitter

    On Oct. 12 Trump signed an executive order eliminating cost-sharing reduction payments to insurance companies. He claims the order will result in lower costs, but according to a report from the Congressional Budget Office, premiums for 2018 would increase by 20% over the CBO's current baseline and by 25% over the 2020 projection. Additionally, about 1 million people would lose coverage in 2018.

    Oct 13 2017

    “The Democrats ObamaCare is imploding. Massive subsidy payments to their pet insurance companies has stopped. Dems should call me to fix!”

    Topic: Health care

    Source: Twitter

    The Affordable Care Act is expected to remain stable for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

    Oct 11 2017

    “Stock Market has increased by 5.2 Trillion dollars since the election on November 8th, a 25% increase. Lowest unemployment in 16 years...”

    Repeated 57 times
    Feb 16Feb 16Feb 18Feb 28Mar 2Jul 2Jul 6Jul 12Jul 12Jul 15Jul 19Jul 24Jul 24Jul 25Jul 29Jul 31Jul 31Aug 1Aug 2Aug 3Aug 3Aug 4Aug 11Aug 14Aug 15Aug 22Sep 1Sep 6Sep 19Sep 22Sep 26Sep 27Sep 29Oct 5Oct 6Oct 6Oct 7Oct 10Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 24Oct 31Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Topic: Economy

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    This is a flip-flop for Trump. Before he was elected, he dismissed the stock-market performance under Obama as “artificial” and “a bubble." It is also a flip-flop to cite an unemployment rate he used to denounce as phony.

    Oct 11 2017

    “It would be really nice if the Fake News Media would report the virtually unprecedented Stock Market growth since the election. Need tax cuts”

    Repeated 57 times
    Feb 16Feb 16Feb 18Feb 28Mar 2Jul 2Jul 6Jul 12Jul 12Jul 15Jul 19Jul 24Jul 24Jul 25Jul 29Jul 31Jul 31Aug 1Aug 2Aug 3Aug 3Aug 4Aug 11Aug 14Aug 15Aug 22Sep 1Sep 6Sep 19Sep 22Sep 26Sep 27Sep 29Oct 5Oct 6Oct 6Oct 7Oct 10Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 11Oct 13Oct 16Oct 16Oct 17Oct 24Oct 31Nov 2Nov 4Nov 5Nov 6Nov 7Nov 7Nov 10Nov 13

    Topic: Economy

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    This is a flip-flop for Trump. Before he was elected, he dismissed the stock-market performance under Obama as “artificial” and “a bubble." Moreover, the stock market highs were regularly reported by the news media.

    Oct 11 2017

    “With all of the Fake News coming out of NBC and the Networks, at what point is it appropriate to challenge their License? Bad for country!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Television networks are not licensed, unlike individual TV stations.

    Oct 11 2017

    “It is about time that Roger Goodell of the NFL is finally demanding that all players STAND for our great National Anthem-RESPECT OUR COUNTRY,”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Trump insists the NFL Commissioner demands that players stand for the anthem, but following his tweet the NFL released a statement noting that Trump's commentary "about the Commissioner’s position on the Anthem is not accurate.” NFL players are encouraged but not required to stand.

    Oct 11 2017

    “Fake @NBCNews made up a story that I wanted a "tenfold" increase in our U.S. nuclear arsenal. Pure fiction, made up to demean. NBC = CNN!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Trump fired off this tweet after NBC reported he called for a nearly tenfold increase in the U.S. nuclear arsenal during a July meeting. NBC stands by its reporting.

    Oct 10 2017

    “Why is the NFL getting massive tax breaks while at the same time disrespecting our Anthem, Flag and Country? Change tax law!”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    This statement needs context. In 2015, the NFL voluntarily gave up tax-exempt status. However, the league can still receive the tax breaks to build stadiums.

    Oct 9 2017

    “Our country has been unsuccessfully dealing with North Korea for 25 years, giving billions of dollars & getting nothing. Policy didn't work!”

    Repeated 1 time
    Oct 8

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    Under the Bill Clinton accord with North Korea, between 1995 and 2003 the United States spent about $400 million supplying the fuel oil to North Korea that was required under the deal. An international consortium spent about $2.5 billion to replace the North’s plutonium reactor with two light-water reactors; the project was not completed before the deal collapsed by the money mostly went to South Korean and Japanese companies, not North Korea. The United States stopped paying food assistance to North Korea after 2011, with the exception of $1 million in humanitarian aid in January 2017 that was negotiated by outgoing Secretary of State John Kerry just before Trump was inaugurated. Total food assistance since 1995 was about $700 million. George W. Bush in 2007-2008 provided about $150 million in fuel oil when engaged in negotiations.

    Oct 8 2017

    “Senator Bob Corker 'begged' me to endorse him for re-election in Tennessee. I said 'NO' and he dropped out (said he could not win without my endorsement.”

    Topic: Miscellaneous

    Source: Twitter

    Todd Womack, Corker's chief of staff, disputed each of the claims the president made in his tweets. Trump called Corker early last week and asked him to reconsider his decision not to seek reelection, according to Womack. He said the president also reaffirmed that he would have endorsed Corker had he decided to run again — which, Womack added, was not the first time that Trump had extended such an offer of support.

    Oct 8 2017

    “Our country has been unsuccessfully dealing with North Korea for 25 years, giving billions of dollars & getting nothing. Policy didn't work!”

    Repeated 1 time
    Oct 9

    Topic: Foreign policy

    Source: Twitter

    Under the Bill Clinton accord with North Korea, between 1995 and 2003 the United States spent about $400 million supplying the fuel oil to North Korea that was required under the deal. An international consortium spent about $2.5 billion to replace the North’s plutonium reactor with two light-water reactors; the project was not completed before the deal collapsed by the money mostly went to South Korean and Japanese companies, not North Korea. The United States stopped paying food assistance to North Korea after 2011, with the exception of $1 million in humanitarian aid in January 2017 that was negotiated by outgoing Secretary of State John Kerry just before Trump was inaugurated. Total food assistance since 1995 was about $700 million. George W. Bush in 2007-2008 provided about $150 million in fuel oil when engaged in negotiations.

    Feb 4 2017

    “What is our country coming to when a judge can halt a Homeland Security travel ban and anyone, even with bad intentions, can come into U.S.?”

    Topic: Immigration

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    Trump tweeted a number of critical comments about the “so-called judge” who halted the president’s travel ban of citizens from seven Muslim-majority countries. The judiciary was established in the U.S. Constitution as a third branch of government (along with the executive and legislative branches), part of the complex system of checks and balances that ensures the continuation of democracy. Marbury v. Madison, a Supreme Court case decided more than 200 years ago, helped establish the notion of judicial review and cemented the notion that the judiciary was equal in power to the president and Congress.

    Feb 4 2017

    “Because the ban was lifted by a judge, many very bad and dangerous people may be pouring into our country. A terrible decision”

    Topic: Immigration

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    There is little evidence that the ruling halting Trump’s order has allowed “very bad and dangerous people” to pour into the country. The practical effect of the order was to restore visas and refugee admissions. Being accepted as a refugee in the United States is a difficult, lengthy process. Obtaining a U.S. visa generally requires an in-person interview, unless you are a citizen of one of 38 countries that participate in the visa-waiver program. Under a 2015 law, however, four of the seven countries covered in the ban require even dual citizens to have an in-person interview.

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

But with refunds, the burden is really paid by the final consumer. Moreover, the VAT also affects domestic producers. In terms of tariffs, it is incorrect the United States charges “nothing or little.” The United States imposes tariffs on Chinese goods, but they are not as high as Chinese tariffs on U.S. goods.

    “Wow, television ratings just out: 31 million people watched the Inauguration, 11 million more than the very good ratings from 4 years ago!”

    Repeated 3 times
    Jan 20Jan 21Jan 25

    Topic: Biographical record

    Source: Twitter

    Full story

    Actually, Obama’s ratings in 2009 were 7 million people higher than Trump’s numbers. Second-term inaugurals tend to get lower ratings, so Trump is cherry-picking the comparison.

    Source: Washington Post reporting. Published May 19, 2017.

    Reporting by Glenn Kessler, Michelle Ye Hee Lee, Meg Kelly and Nicole Lewis. Design and development by Leslie Shapiro.
